original_solution_mapping.L1: First find the total number of 3- and 4-year-olds: 13 kids + 20 kids = <<13+20=33>>33 kids
original_solution_mapping.L2: Then find the total number of 5- and 6-year-olds: 15 kids + 22 kids = <<15+22=37>>37 kids
original_solution_mapping.L3: Then add the two class sizes: 33 kids + 37 kids = <<33+37=70>>70 kids
original_solution_mapping.L4: Then divide the number of kids by the number of classes to find the average class size: 70 kids / 2 classes = <<70/2=35>>35 kids/class

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5535.
    Returns: the average class size.
    """
    # L1
    three_year_olds = 13 # 13 3-year-olds
    four_year_olds = 20 # 20 4-year-olds
    class_one_size = three_year_olds + four_year_olds

    # L2
    five_year_olds = 15 # 15 5-year-olds
    six_year_olds = 22 # 22 six-year-olds
    class_two_size = five_year_olds + six_year_olds

    # L3
    total_kids = class_one_size + class_two_size

    # L4
    number_of_classes = 2 # in one class and ... in another class
    average_class_size = total_kids / number_of_classes

    # FA
    answer = average_class_size
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: First find the total number of 3- and 4-year-olds: {three_year_olds} kids + {four_year_olds} kids = <<{three_year_olds}+{four_year_olds}={class_one_size}>>{class_one_size} kids
Then find the total number of 5- and 6-year-olds: {five_year_olds} kids + {six_year_olds} kids = <<{five_year_olds}+{six_year_olds}={class_two_size}>>{class_two_size} kids
Then add the two class sizes: {class_one_size} kids + {class_two_size} kids = <<{class_one_size}+{class_two_size}={total_kids}>>{total_kids} kids

Then divide the number of kids by the number of classes to find the average class size: {total_kids} kids / {number_of_classes} classes = <<{total_kids}/{number_of_classes}={average_class_size}>>{average_class_size} kids/class
